results.title: Basilisk stare
results.creator_credit: Chryss Carr, Mis Kamieniak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A psychosexual drama which launches the viewer into the inner-space of the male psyche in order to depict the way the modern male constructs sex. The film excites and disturbs the viewer with the use of a split screen, which allows for the pitching of two images against each other in order to create a sense of both excitement and voyeuristic curiosity.
Cast includes David Wenham, Amy Pedersen and Jared Turner

results.title: Basilisk
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Sharp, Panos Couros and Wayne Stamp
results.brief_description: ‘Basilisk’ is an interactive CD-Rom that operates as a conceptual journey into an ancient illustrated philosophical text and an imaginary bestiary. Through labryinthine visuals and language, ‘Basilisk’ charts a fiction of the genesis of the male as a queered perspective on subjectivity. As the artists state: “It derives its intensities from an alchemistry of mediaeval marvels and a bricolage of contemporary nomadic thought… Basilisk diagrams the multiple relations that converge upon a making of the male that is monstrous and virtual. As a queered perspective on subjectivity, it derives itself from a hybrid relation between the alchemistry of wonder and a wander in the fourfold thought of the subject in Felix Guattari’s philophical text ‘Chaosmosis’.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lloyd Sharp, Panos Couros and Wayne Stamp

results.title: Basil's adventure
results.brief_description: An interactive 2-d animation based on a small boy called Basil. Using interactive elements and characters, you can help Basil to find his way home. The 7 minute animation was aimed at the young, but all ages should enjoy it. Very entertaining and quite amusing.

results.title: Basics of direct instruction
results.brief_description: Gives an overview of the Direct Instruction technique which was developed in the 1960’s to develop successful students with a positive approach and works on problem solving skills so students learn to learn. Skills are broken into sub-skills until mastered and integrated. Notes the goals, assumptions and characteristics of Direct Instruction programmes, provides a brief description of teaching techniques and how to prepare a Direct Instruction program.

results.title: Basically Black
results.brief_description: Basically Black combined comedy, activism and performing arts while reflecting the political struggles and organising of 1960s and 70s Redfern. The first TV program written and performed by an all-Indigenous cast, this groundbreaking program tackled racism and white paternalism through humour.

constellations_primary.name: Laughing in the face of adversity
constellations_primary.description: Comedy has been used by First Nations storytellers as a tool for social change. On our screens, humour invites audiences to engage with stories and prompts them to grapple with ideas that they otherwise might shy away from.

constellations_other.name: Sequins and sapphires
constellations_other.description: Two of the most striking costumes on the big and small screens embody the glamour of leading First Peoples ladies.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.description: “Good morning, I am a human being,” Bindi Williams tells the audience during an opening skit of Basically Black (1973). Evolving from the newly established National Black Theatre’s stage production, Basically Black combined comedy, activism and performing arts while reflecting the political struggles and organising of 1960s and 70s Redfern. The first TV program performed by an all-Indigenous cast and led by Blak writers, this groundbreaking program tackled serious issues, like racism and white paternalism, through humour. Despite being well received for its biting satire and commentary, the show didn’t air beyond its premiere. It later emerged that it was considered too political and provocative for the ABC, who had censored parts of the script.
description_for_label: “Good morning, I am a human being,” Bindi Williams tells the audience during an opening skit of Basically Black (1973). Evolving from the newly established National Black Theatre’s stage production, Basically Black combined comedy, activism and performing arts while reflecting the political struggles and organising of 1960s and 70s Redfern. The first TV program performed by an all-Indigenous cast and led by Blak writers, this groundbreaking program tackled serious issues, like racism and white paternalism, through humour. Despite being well received for its biting satire and commentary, the show didn’t air beyond its premiere. It later emerged that it was considered too political and provocative for the ABC, who had censored parts of the script.

results.title: Basic woodwork: Preparing the wood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
After explaining the need for making a rough sketch and dimensional drawings of the article to be made, this film goes on to explain the drawing up of a cutting list of the sizes of the various pieces of wood required for the job.
